revised_title: Ireland's Bog Bogging: Strata, Horns, and Curiosities
tldr: James Kelly describes his findings while digging for marl in Ireland. He details the various strata encountered, including moss, gravel, leaves, clay, and shells. He also mentions discovering elk horns and other bones of these beasts in the same location. This letter provides a glimpse into the natural history and geology of Ireland during the 18th century.
